result.execSummary:
The defendant Colton R. Melander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
04/07/2015:  Court orders 4 days credit if revoked.

15CF14 was dismissed and read in
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF25, 15CF148 and 15CF13

miscConds.notes:
Not to use/possess any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia
Not to use/possess any non prescription drugs not prescribed to him.
No contact with S.F., H.L., Kohls Department stores or any RCU branches.

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge
Any treatment/programming per agent recommendation.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
30 days can be replaced with 240 hours of community service.
Can be served in Chippewa if at no cost to Eau Claire County
30 days to report.
